meanings.definition: To rub or wear away by friction.
meanings.sent1: The rough fabric was chafing against my skin.
meanings.sent2: She was chafing the wood to make it smooth.
meanings.sent3: The constant chafing of the rope against the tree made it squeak like a mouse.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to chafe against his patience, wearing it thin.
meanings.sent5: The sandpaper chafed the surface until it was perfectly smooth.

meanings.sent1: The loud noise was chafing her nerves.
meanings.sent2: His constant complaints were chafing everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The persistent buzzing of the fly was starting to chafe on his sanity.
meanings.sent4: Her words chafed against his pride, leaving him feeling defensive.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive sound of the dripping faucet chafed at her patience.

meanings.definition: A sore or irritation caused by rubbing.
meanings.sent1: He developed chafing on his feet after wearing tight shoes.
meanings.sent2: The hiker applied ointment to the chafing on his thighs.
meanings.sent3: The chafing from the new shoes made him walk like a penguin.
meanings.sent4: The emotional chafing from their argument left a mark on their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The chafing on her hands from the rough work gloves was painful.
